result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas S Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly conduct - domestic [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas S Lowe

defendant.name: Lowe, Lucas S
defendant.address: 530 Bolson Drive, Unit C, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.addlTxt: signed by Judge Dennis P. Moroney October 19, 2022.
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Paul Bucher.

10:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.    Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Lucas S Lowe.  Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Bucher presents statements and notes the State is prepared to amend to a County Ordinance today.  State confirms and moves to have Count 1 amended to County Ordinance 13-102(c)(8), with the DA enhancer, and requests a $10.00 fine plus costs.  Atty. Bucher will accept the amendment and enters a no contest plea on behalf of his client.  Court will accept the plea of no contest and find the defendant guilty of County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct 13-102(c)(8) and will order a $10.00 fine plus  costs.


COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $317.10 (includes DV surcharge);
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days .   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

10:34 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court.   Defendant Lucas S Lowe did not appear.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Bucher provides an update, he is still working out a resolution with the State.  Atty. Bucher requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Authorization to appear received and filed.

08:40 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Lucas S Lowe in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Bucher provides an update, and advises that the victim in this case is now deceased.  Atty. Bucher advises he has been working with the ADA assigned to the case to try to resolve the matter, and is asking for another further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing June 15, 2022.

LF 5/26--sent to BC: mailed copy of Order and payment letter to defendant. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:17 AM Defendant Lucas S Lowe in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants the request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing June 15, 2022.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
